About the Product:
Hazelnuts are encased in a hard brown shell, soft but are the majority generally sold shelled.
The cream-colored kernel, sweet-tasting is round and little, with a pointed tip.
It thin, dark brown skin is faintly bitter, so some people like to take away this before eating.
Nutritional Facts:
Nutritional Value:
Calories: 9 ,
Carbs: 0g  ,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 0g.
How to Use:
Hazelnuts are often chopped and used in desserts like pastries, pies, truffles, biscotti, cookies, tarts, and macaroons.
Hazelnuts can be used in savory meals like pasta, ravioli, and pesto.

About the Product:
Coriander powder is a finely ground spice made from dried coriander seeds. It has a warm, mild, and slightly citrusy flavour, making it a versatile ingredient in many cuisines. Coriander powder is commonly used in Indian, Middle Eastern, and Latin American dishes, adding depth to curries, soups, stews, and marinades. It is also a key component in various spice blends, such as garam masala and curry powder. This aromatic spice enhances the flavour profile of both savoury and sweet recipes.
How to Use:
To make spicy coriander potatoes, In a large skillet or wok, warm the oil until it's shimmering but not smoking.Add the fennel seeds; they should sizzle upon contact with the oil.Immediately add the boiled potatoes, coriander, turmeric, thyme, salt, and pepper.Stir-fry until the potatoes get crispy and golden brown on the outside.Finish with the fresh cilantro and lime juice and serve.

About the Product:
Explore the ‘Curry’ experience with this classic blend that gives vegetable curries a lordly taste and a mild, subdued flavour. Being coriander and turmeric based, the blend gives curry an appetising golden hue. It is the recommended blend to prepare India’s much loved vegetarian dish – Home-bred Cheese in fresh green peas: Mattar Paneer.Paneer curries and light gravies are enhanced with the fragrance and taste of Everest Kitchen King.
Ingredients:
Coriander, Cumin, turmeric, black pepper, garlic, dry ginger, mace, cardamom, cardamom seed, bengal gram, black, nutmeg, fenugreek, poppy seed, chilli, cassia, clove, caraway, anistar, dry fenugreek leaf, cammon salt, asafetida, mustard and black cardamom.
How to Use:
Ideal for vegetable & paneer dishes with mild curry.

About the Product:

Source of Potassium & Dietary Fibre. The delectable flavour and deluxe size of these raisins make them a great choice for wholesome snacking. These Black Raisins are a source of potassium and dietary fibre. With up to 20 quality parameters tested, Tata Sampann dry fruits offer only the choicest selection of Black Raisins/kali draksh. Great choice for Pre-Breakfast and Evening Snacking. With their sweet and juicy taste, Tata Sampann 100% Pure Afghani Black Raisins are your answer to delicious and wholesome snacking. Consume a handful of Black Raisins soaked overnight or add these Black Raisins to your favourite sweet delights, and your sweet cravings are sorted. About the Product:
Mace, also known as Javitri, is the dried outer covering of the nutmeg seed. It has a warm, aromatic flavour that is slightly more delicate than nutmeg. Mace whole is commonly used in Indian, Middle Eastern, and European cuisines to enhance the flavour of savoury dishes, desserts, and beverages. It is often added to soups, sauces, and spice blends. Mace's distinct aroma and taste make it a valuable spice in both traditional and contemporary cooking.
How to Use:
It is used in flavouring stews, curries, pickles, sauces, and ketchup.Mace is added to sweet puddings, muffins, cakes and breads to impart its flavour.

To make spicy coriander potatoes, In a large skillet or wok, warm the oil until it's shimmering but not smoking.

Immediately add the boiled potatoes, coriander, turmeric, thyme, salt, and pepper.

About the Product:
Everest Hing-Asafoetida Powder is a staple in Indian kitchens, prized for its pungent aroma and flavour-enhancing properties. Derived from the resin of the asafoetida plant, it adds a unique umami depth to dishes. Used in both vegetarian and non-vegetarian cooking, Everest Hing is a key ingredient in curries, dals, and pickles. Its digestive benefits and ability to harmonize diverse spices make it indispensable in Indian cuisine. Packed with care to preserve its potency, Everest Hing-Asafoetida Powder ensures each dish is infused with authentic flavour, making it a must-have for anyone seeking to elevate their culinary creations.

About the Product:
For most Indians, comfort food is always linked to easy-to-cook homemade meals, and what can be more convenient and quick than preparing a hearty dal meal? Essential in every household, Tata Sampann dals are unpolished and do not undergo any artificial polishing with water, oil, or leather, thereby retaining their goodness and wholesome character. The 5-step process ensures that Tata Sampann grains are uniform and of premium quality, giving you an all-natural, authentic taste. A staple in the Indian diet, Rajma provides nutrients such as protein and fibre. Made of select grains and recommended by Chef Sanjeev Kapoor and Chef Ranveer Brar, Tata Sampann Unpolished Rajma makes for a delicious meal choice. So whenever you are in the mood to cook something easy and delicious, dive into the scrumptious taste of Tata Sampann pulses and enjoy a lovely meal! Explore Tata Sampann Pulses range - Toor dal, Chana dal, Moong dal, Moong dal Chilka, Green Moong, Masoor dal, Kabuli Chana, Masoor Whole dal, Kali Masoor dal, Urad dal, Urad Whole dal, Urad Kali, Kala Chana, and Rajma.
How to Use:
Have Rajma dry or with gravy along with roti or rice. |

About the Product:
Shahjeera, as the name says, is also identified as royal cumin due to its robust cumin smell and taste. Shahjeera has a strong flavour and an interesting, extravagant aroma mostly used for biryani or as a seasoning. It can be used for flavouring biscuits, pickling spice, pieces of bread etc, and is also a superb cure for digestive problems. Shah jeera soothe the digestive tract and relieve colic, cramps, bloating and flatulence by directly acting on the intestinal muscles. The powder of the seeds also helps heal bruises. Improves appetite and is helpful in treating earache. Counters heart irregularity caused by excess digestive gas.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 100,
Carbs: 25 g,
Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 0 g.
How to Use:
Shahjeera or Siya jeera is widely used for flavouring bread, biscuits, cakes and cheese.
Benefits:
Contains antioxidants.
It has anti-cancer properties.
May help treat diarrhea.
Helps control blood sugar.

About the Product: Shahjeera, also known as Royal Cumin, is a premium spice renowned for its aromatic and slightly sweet flavour. Bajra flour or millet flour is made from a small round grain resembling mustard seed. It has a slightly nutty flavour. The millet is small-seeded species of cereal crops. About the Product:
Chilli powder is a spice blend made primarily from ground dried chilli peppers, mixed with other spices such as cumin, garlic powder, and oregano. It varies widely in heat level depending on the types of chillies used. Commonly used in cooking to add heat and flavour to dishes like curries, stews, and marinades, chilli powder also contributes vibrant colour and depth. It's a versatile ingredient that can be adjusted in quantity to suit personal taste preferences, making it essential in many cuisines around the world.
How to Use:
Chilli powder is commonly used in Indian cuisine to make foods spicier.Include in any pot of beans or with baked corn and casseroles.It can also be used to make marinades for paneer or sliced vegetables.

About the Product:
Vijay Besan is also known as gram flour that comes from chickpeas, or garbanzo beans as they are called in the US. This flour is naturally gluten-free, a good source of fibre as well as protein making it a valuable part of a vegetarian diet. It is a good source of zinc, a mineral that helps the immune system and also has antioxidant potential. It has countless roles including muscle relaxation and bone density. It is fairly neutral, slightly nutty, slightly “bean-y” flavour, it can be used in both savoury and sweet dishes. Besan is made from carefully selected chickpeas. Good for your heart. Besan contains soluble fibre, which keeps your heart healthy. Hygienically processed. High on energy.
Ingredients:
Gram (Chanana) Dal Flour

Rice Rawa.

About the Product:
Aashirvaad ensures that only superior quality ingredients reach your kitchen, and Aashirvaad Turmeric Powder stays true to that word. Aashirvaad Turmeric Powder has been made with love in India using a 4-step advantage process to ensure that only a high-quality product reaches your kitchen.
With a wide network of farmers, Aashirvaad sources raw turmeric directly from the farmers. The raw turmeric is then carefully selected by experts, which are then traditionally sun-dried and thoroughly cleaned to get a turmeric powder that is perfectly balanced in colour and taste. The automated packaging and processing with zero human intervention ensure purity in every pack.
With no added flavours and colours, Aashirvaad Turmeric Powder is naturally golden. It is so potent that even a tiny quantity enhances the colour and flavour of the dish. So, add a pinch of this turmeric powder to bring alive the vibrant colour and authentic taste of your food!
Ingredients:
Whole Turmeric
Nutritional Facts:

Protein (g) 14.14

Features:
1.Aashirvaad Turmeric Powder is made using a 4-step advantage process to ensure high-quality turmeric powder
2.Raw turmeric for Aashirvaad Turmeric Powder is sourced directly from the farmers
3.The turmeric is selected by experts in a traditional way – crisp, sun-dried and thoroughly cleaned to ensure great flavour and naturally golden colour

About the Product:
Almonds, or 'Badam' as they are referred to in India, come in several varieties, with 'Mamra' and 'Giri' being the most popular ones. Mamra almonds are known for their premium quality, superior taste, and high nutritional value. They are often consumed raw or used in making sweets and snacks. Giri almonds, on the other hand, are the shelled version of almonds, also known as almond kernels. They have a slightly bitter taste due to the presence of certain natural chemicals but are much loved for their crunchiness and versatility. Giri almonds are often used in Indian cuisine in a variety of dishes, from savoury curries and biryanis to sweet desserts like kheer and halwa. The almond, with its rich taste and nutritional profile, holds a significant place in Indian culinary traditions.

About the Product:
Everest Jeera Powder, a staple in Indian kitchens, embodies the rich essence of cumin seeds, integral to traditional Indian cuisine. This finely ground spice adds depth and earthiness to dishes ranging from curries to rice preparations. Known for its distinctive warm aroma and robust flavour, Everest Jeera Powder is meticulously crafted to preserve the essence of freshly ground cumin seeds. In Indian cooking, it plays a crucial role in tempering, enhancing gravies, and adding a finishing touch to many dishes. Its versatility extends beyond its use in main courses; it is also a key ingredient in refreshing beverages like jeera water, known for its digestive properties. Everest Jeera Powder stands out for its quality, consistency, and ability to elevate the taste of everyday meals, making it a cherished companion in every Indian kitchen.

About the Product:
Phaseolus lunatus, commonly known as the lima bean, butter bean, sieva bean, double bean, or Madagascar bean, is a legume grown for its edible seeds or beans. They are delicious in a variety of dishes and an excellent substitute for meat. These beans are high in protein, iron, fibre and other nutrients and low in fat, cholesterol, and sodium.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 306,
Carbs: 63 g,
Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 20 g.
How to Use:
Double beans are very commonly used in Gujarati cuisine.
It can be used in curries, side dish and many other ways.
Benefits:
Beans are a reliable source of fibre.
Beans are a wonderful way to get the low-fat, low-calorie protein that already has the fibre and carbs mixed in.
If you make it a habit to eat beans, you're more likely to has a lower body weight, slimmer waist, and a lower body mass index.

About the Product:
Hing (or asafoetida) is a resinous gum derived from the roots of the Ferula plant. Hing has a characteristic pungent smell, and it is commonly used in Indian cuisine as a flavour enhancer. Its strong aroma and taste make it a popular substitute for onions and garlic. Patanjali Bandhani Hing (unrefined asafoetida) is a premium-quality hing recognized for its quality and strong aroma. Major ingredients in Patanjali Bandhani Hing include edible cereal flour, gum Arabic, and asafoetida.

About the Product:
Saffron threads are renowned for their unique flavour, vibrant colour, and aromatic properties. Known as the world's most expensive spice, saffron is treasured for its ability to enhance dishes with a rich, golden hue and distinctive taste. A small pinch is enough to impart depth and warmth to a variety of culinary creations, including risottos, paellas, and desserts. Rich in antioxidants, saffron also offers potential health benefits, making it a prized ingredient in both cooking and traditional medicine.
How to Use:
Saffron is especially good when used in cooking seafood dishes such as bouillabaisse and paella.It is also used in risotto and other rice dishes.Try adding some to your next stew or tomato-based sauce.To make a wonderful marinade for fish, add saffron threads, garlic, and thyme to vinegar.

About the Product:
Ponni raw rice is a variety of rice known for its distinct aroma, soft texture, and nutritional benefits. Ponni rice is typically used to make plain steamed rice, biryanis, and other rice-based dishes. It has a slightly sticky texture when cooked, making it ideal for dishes where a soft and fluffy consistency is desired. Ponni raw rice is valued for its versatility and is a staple in South Indian cuisine for its flavour and cooking properties.
How to Use:
Wash and soak the rice for 30 min.Heat pan & add 6 cups of water, let it boil.Once it's boiled add soaked kolam rice. Cook till soft.Once it's ready, cut off heat, cover lid & leave it for 5 min.Then serve hot with any gravy.

About the Product:
Garlic Powder is derived from dehydrated garlic. It is used for flavour enhancement. The addition of Garlic to food helps improve immunity and fight the common cold and cough. Garlic has been used in eastern medicine and traditional Indian recipes. It is a common spice that has been loved through the generations. Garlic powder is a popular ingredient in spice blends and dry rubs.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 27,
Carbs: 6 g,
Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 1 g.
How to Use:
It’s used to season meat and veggies and proves a welcome addition in snacks like popcorn and roasted nuts.
Garlic powder can even be used to get brighter flavors in low-sodium dishes.
Garlic Powder usually used to flavour curries, dips, sauces, ketchups, etc.
Benefits:
It has been proven to lower cholesterol and thin the blood, which helps prevent stroke, high blood pressure and heart disease.
It blocks the growth of cancer cells; therefore, people who eat garlic tend to develop less stomach and colon cancers.
Garlic powder is also alleged to help regulate blood sugar levels.

About the Product:
Premium Basmati rice is a high-quality, long-grain rice known for its distinct aroma and delicate, fluffy texture. Often used in Indian and Middle Eastern cuisines, it is ideal for dishes such as biryanis, pilafs, and stir-fries. Its unique fragrance and superior cooking qualities make it a preferred choice for both everyday meals and special occasions.
Storage and Uses:
It is the best choice to make plain rice and dishes like Jeera Rice, Fried Rice, Kheer, Khichdi, etc. Store in a cool, dry place away from direct sunlight.

About the Product:
Indira foods bring you 100 % Natural tomato paste. This tomato paste is made from the finest quality tomatoes which give it a uniform and homogeneous consistency without fibre, seed and peel pieces. It is seven times concentrated tomato pulp. Every 1 Kg of Indira tomato paste is equivalent to approximately 7 Kg of tomatoes. It can be used in multi-cuisine recipes for a natural tomato flavour. Perfect for making savoury dishes.
Ingredients:
100% Tomatoes
Nutritional Facts:

Total Carbohydrates - 4g (2%)

Iron - 0.54 mg
How to Use:
Add as a substitute to tomato in your daily cooking fr smoother consistency
Perfect for gravies
Versatile with multi-cuisine dishes

About the Product:
Phaseolus lunatus, commonly known as the lima bean, butter bean, sieva bean, double bean, or Madagascar bean, is a legume grown for its edible seeds or beans. They are delicious in a variety of dishes and an excellent substitute for meat. These beans are high in protein, iron, fibre and other nutrients and low in fat, cholesterol, and sodium.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 306,
Carbs: 63 g,
Fat: 0 g,
Protein: 20 g.
How to Use:
Double beans are very commonly used in Gujarati cuisine.
It can be used in curries, side dish and many other ways.
Benefits:
Beans are a great source of fiber.
Beans are a great way to get the low-fat, low-calorie protein that already has the fiber and carbs mixed in.
If you make it a habit to eat beans, you're more likely to has a lower body weight, slimmer waist, and a lower body mass index.
Eating a variety of beans not only seems to help prevent diabetes, but it also appears to help control the high blood sugar that is both a cause and symptom of the disease.

About the Product:
Switz is the only focused manufacturer of authentic, wheat batter-based, all-purpose spring roll pastry in India. Switz Spring Roll Sheets have high elasticity and strength. Big or small, fried or baked (at 180-degree Celsius or till its golden brown), sweet or savoury, what you will make at home will always be crispy. Just let your imagination go wild on the fillings, and make food magic.Switz Spring Roll Sheets Filling Suggestions: Chicken, Mix veg, macaroni and cheese, noodle spring roll, baby corn lollipop.Other recipes: Banana fritters, chocolate cigars, money bags, fried wontons, fish roll, tarts, cheese-filled bites. It is suitable for both fresh and frozen preparation.
Ingredients:
Refined Wheat Flour (Maida - Gluten), Water, Corn Starch, Salt, Edible Vegetable Oil (Sunflower Oil), Emulsifier E322 (Soya-Based), E481+E471, Preservative E282.
How to Use:
Thaw for 45 minutes wrap it in a damp cloth to retain moisture.Fold the sheet as in the pictures. Use your choice of filling.Deep fry at medium heat till golden brown.

About the Product:
Bajra, also known as pearl millet, is a traditional grain that is widely used in the culinary traditions of many regions, particularly in India, Africa, and the Middle East. It is celebrated for its hearty, slightly nutty flavour, and its adaptability to a wide range of dishes. Bajra can be ground into flour and used for making rotis, breads, and porridge, or used whole in soups, stews, and salads. It is a robust crop that can thrive in harsh and dry conditions where other crops fail, making it a staple in arid regions. Despite the advent of more modern grains, bajra continues to hold its own, cherished for the unique, rustic flavour it imparts to dishes.

About the Product:
Catch  Sprinklers Iodised Table Salt improves optimum hydration levels of your body and keeps the electrolytes balanced. 

Use this salt in your dishes to elevate the richness of your spices as well as to preserve them for a long period of time. The right amount of iodised salt in your food goes beyond the taste factor. Iodized salt is beneficial to your health if taken in moderation. Salt is generally fortified with iodine, which is why it's called iodized salt. Including iodized salt in your diet can aid in normal thyroid function. If you don't consume enough seafood, dairy products, eggs and you fear a potential iodine deficiency, iodised salt is the best option.

product_USP: Good Source of Carbohydrates & Gluten Free
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Red poha or red rice flakes are nothing but flattened rice made from red rice. Red poha nutrition value is high compared to white rice flakes. It has health benefits in terms of having more iron content and is also easy to digest. Red poha is made from red rice, it contains a pigment called anthocyanin, which is also a flavonoid that doesn't undergo excessive processing, and as such the other bran layer remains intact, which is rich in fibre, vitamin B, and minerals like calcium, zinc, iron, manganese, magnesium etc.
Ingredients:
Flattened Rice Red
Benefits:
Poha is a wholesome meal.
It is a good source of carbohydrates, packed with iron, rich in fibre, a good source of antioxidants and essential vitamins and is gluten-free.
It is known to be good for those who have diabetes, skin and heart problems.
How to Use:
You can use red poha to make breakfast dishes.
It can also be used in salads, quick stir-fries and many other ways.
You can also make lip-smacking chaats with boiled potatoes, and tamarind and mint chutneys.
Other Product Info:

From the Brand:
About the ProductFresho Signature presents an array of dry fruits apart from the ordinary to give you the best of the best to indulge. Want to try something other than a regular fruit? This sweetened dry fruit mix is a healthy alternative to munch on when hunger strikes. It contains papaya, apple, pineapple, mango, black grape, strawberry and sulphurless sugar. Easy to carry, it makes a great snack to keep you going throughout the day.

Our candied dry fruit range is here to be your snack buddy and your healthy sugar high. It can also be used as some sweet goodness to your breakfast cereals, for baking, as dessert toppings and to make traditional sweets. They are sweetened with sulphurless sugar and liquid glucose to enhance the zing. There are 0 added preservatives, artificial colour and flavour to retain the original fruit essence and keep it natural and healthy.
Ingredients:
Papaya, Apple, Pineapple, Mango, Black Grape, Strawberry & Sugar

About the Product:
Walnut Kernels not only add crunch and taste to a dish but they are loaded with nutritional benefits too. They are a rich source of heart-healthy fats and an excellent source of those hard-to-find omega-3 fatty acids. Walnuts are vacuum packaged to retain freshness, taste, and texture, ensuring quality. All products are hygienically packed in a facility meeting food safety standards.Product details: Diet balance - adding walnuts to your diet may help you maintain your ideal weight over time. Researchers have shown that consuming walnuts on a regular basis may help you reduce stress and slow down ageing, as they are found to consist of vitamin E and antioxidants. Multivitamins - walnuts contain several neuroprotective compounds including vitamin E, vitamin B, folate, melatonin, omega-3 fats, and antioxidants. Health benefits - walnuts are primarily made up of polyunsaturated fat.
Benefits:
Walnuts have a wealth of good kinds of fats - polyunsaturated fats which are better than saturated fats. They also have a high amount of omega-3 fatty acids. Walnuts can help lower LDL (bad) cholesterol in particular, but also lower your cholesterol overall. Super Plant Source of Omega-3s.
How to Use:
Walnuts are often crushed to sprinkle over salads and desserts, particularly sundaes and other ice creams, and are also used as seafood toppings. Best accompanied with tea or for an on-the-go munch. Pop some before hitting the gym or spruce up your salad or morning cereal.

About the Product:
Finest quality split coriander seeds roasted and mildly salted; crunchy and crisp. A traditional mouth freshener and an excellent post-meal digestive. Coriander Seeds are rich in Vit-C (the only seed to do so), Vit-B family and thiamin, riboflavin, and niacin. Coriander seeds are anti-bacterial, anti-microbial and anti-inflammatory in nature, and hence, consuming dhana dal after meals can have many medicinal benefits.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 218,
Carbs: 7 g,
Fat: 15 g,
Protein: 14 g.
How to Use:
These seeds are used in curry powder, curries, sausages, pickles, stews and sauces.
Add coriander to your pepper grinder. Mix white peppercorns with some coriander seed. It will give your pepper a nice mildness and tastes great on vegetables and eggs.
Benefits:
Coriander is anti-bacterial, anti-microbial and anti-inflammatory in nature.
Consuming dhania dal after meals can have many medicinal benefits.
Dhania Dal is made by roasting whole coriander seeds and then adding a pinch of salt.
It is most commonly eaten as a mouth freshener / after mint.

About the Product:
Everest presents their authentic range of masalas that are blended with a wide variety of handpicked and selected spices that bring a whole new flavour and meaning to your dishes. Rake up your favourite recipes and cuisines by adding this magical blend of Everest masalas.
Ingredients:
Coriander, Dry Mango, Chilli, Cumin, Cassia leaf, mint leaf, pomegranate seed, Mustard, Cassia, Clove, Black Pepper, Fennel, Dry Ginger, Common salt, Black salt,Nutmeg, Mace, Caraway, Black cardamom, Turmeric, Bishop's weed, Asafoetida, Tamarind and Malic acid
How to Use:
Soak 100g of chhole overnight. Cook and keep aside. Heat 3 tbsp oil, fry 2 chopped onions till golden brown. Add 1 tsp each of chilli powder and coriander powder. Add 1 tbsp Everest Chhole masala. Fry for 3 min on a low flame. Add 1 chopped tomato, 3 slit green chillies and 1/2 inch ginger, finely sliced and salt to taste. Add boiled chhole. Add salt, cook for 5 min. For added flavour put 1/2 tsp chaat masala and kasuri methi. Serve hot with roti/rice.

About the Product:
Maize flour is derived from the ground and desiccated seed of the maize plant and is a wholesome addition to your diet.
The organic staple is the second most produced and consumed after wheat flour.
It is naturally rich in dietary fiber, Vitamin B, Omega 6 unsaturated fat, magnesium and vegetable proteins.
BB Royal’s Organic Maize Flour/ Makka Atta is a premium staple, packed with nutrients.
BB Royal is a premium brand of organic staples by Big Basket.
The entire range of products is sourced from the best of farms to ensure high-quality standards.
All BB Royal products are cleaned and packed in hygienic facilities in high-quality food-grade packaging.
There is a no questions asked return policy on all BB Royal products in a bid to provide you nothing but the best!

Carbs: 18 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 1 g.

Maize contains valuable B vitamins, which are important to your overall health.
Corn also provides our bodies with essential minerals such as zinc, magnesium, copper, iron and manganese.
Corn is a good source of the antioxidants carotenoids, lutein and zeaxanthin, which promote eye health.
How to Use:
You can use maize flour to make a variety of confectionaries, as a binding agent for puddings and fritters, or as a thickener for soups and gravies

From the Brand:
About the ProductIt’s never too late to start munching something healthy! Fresho Signature’s seed mix is the perfect option to snack on when hunger strikes. The pack contains flax seeds, sesame seeds, sunflower seeds, pumpkin and melon seeds that are cleaned, dehydrated and packed to be your snack buddy. The combination of these handpicked seeds may aid in weight loss, immunity boosting, increasing energy and keeping you fit. They give you zero cholesterol.
Flax seeds are renowned for their health benefits as they are rich in dietary fibre and Omega 3 fatty acids. Sesame seeds are known to have a large amount of fibre and they are a great source of plant protein. When it comes to sunflower seeds, they carry healthy fats that your body needs. Pumpkin seeds are packed with antioxidants and Vitamin B. Want to boost your immunity? Then melon seeds are a great source of zinc, iron and magnesium that aid in keeping your body strong.  Loaded with various nutrients these seeds great for your everyday dose of healthy snacking.
Ingredients:
Sesame (white) Seed, Melon Seed, Flax Seed, Pumpkin Seed and Sunflower Seed.
Nutritional Facts:
Energy (kcal) - 529.6,
Carbohydrate (g) - 27.4,
Total Sugar (g) - 1.07,
Protein (g) - 20.32,
Total fat (g) - 41.4,
Iron (mg) - 7.04,
Vitamin A (mg) - 23.8,
Vitamin C (mg) - 0.48,
Cholesterol (mg) - 0.
How to Use:
Can be snacked on directly.
The seeds mix can be used to add crunch to desserts and sweets.
The mix is perfect to enhance salads.
Add it to your breakfast cereals or smoothie.
Other Product Info:

About the Product:
Cloves are the aromatic flower buds of a tree in the family Myrtaceae, Syzygium aromaticum. A popular commonly used spice in all Indian kitchens, Cloves, fondly called as, “laung”, “Lavanga”, “grambu”, “laving” etc in local terms. Cloves are also high in antioxidants, which may help prevent liver disease due to their ability to help decrease oxidative stress.

About the Product:
Everest presents their authentic range of masalas that are blended with a wide variety of handpicked and selected spices that bring a whole new flavour and meaning to your dishes. Rake up your favourite recipes and cuisines by adding this magical blend of Everest masalas.
Ingredients:
Coriander, Chilli, Cumin, Black Pepper, Garlic, Cassia, Dry Ginger, Nutmeg, Mace, Clove, Black Cardamom, Fenugreek, Dry Fenugreek leaf, Black gram,Bengal gram, Asafoetida, Common salt and Turmeric
How to Use:
Marinate 750g chicken pieces with 1 tsp chilli powder, 1 tsp ginger-garlic paste, 1/2 tsp turmeric powder, 3 tbsp curd and salt. Keep for 1 hour. Heat 4 tbsp oil, fry 4 chopped onions till crisp. Add 3 chopped green chillies, 1 tsp ginger -galic paste, 1 tsp coriander powder, 1 tsp turmeric powder and 3 tsp Everst chicken Masala. Fry for 1 min. Add marinated chicken and 4 chopped tomatoes. Cook for 10 min. Serve hot with rice or roti.

About the Product:
Organic Tattva Organic Moong Dal/Dhuli is one of the best vegetarian Superfoods that has been praised for its amazing health benefits. Whether cooked or eaten raw when sprouted, Moong dal is always tasty and an excellent source of valuable nutrients and protein. This moong dal delivers pure, healthy, chemical and pesticide-free cooking ingredients that make your lifestyle healthier.1. It is rich in Vitamin A, B, C and E and also in many minerals including iron, calcium, and potassium.
2. It is considered a healthy weight loss food as it is a low-fat food rich in proteins and fiber.
3. It helps to lower the high cholesterol level in the blood system.
4. It is easy to cook and makes delicious food.
Ingredients:
Moong Dal
How to Use:
1. Split moong beans can be ground in a mill or blender and used to make vegetable fritters.
2. Heat oil in the pressure cooker on a medium-high flame. Add cumin seeds, and green chili and sauté for 30 seconds.
3. Add onions, ginger and garlic. Sauté for 3 minutes.
4. Add chopped tomato, and spices and stir.
5. Add lentils and water. Stir well.
6. Cover the lid, turn the heat on to high flame and pressure cook it until you hear two whistles. Now reduce the flame to medium and pressure cook it for another 8 minutes. Let the pressure release naturally.
7. Open the lid and add lime juice and cilantro. Stir and green moong dal are ready to be served.
Nutritional Facts:

Calories from Fat : 10
Total Fat : 1g
Saturated Fat : 0g
Trans Fat : 0g
Cholesterol : 0mg
Sodium : 30mg

Dietary Fiber : 4g
Sugars : 0g
Protein : 24g

How to Use:
Bring 2½ cups water to a boil in a medium saucepan set over medium-high heat. Meanwhile, rinse 1 cup rice under cool water.
When the water reaches a boil, add the rice, butter, and salt. Reduce to a simmer, cover, and leave to cook until tender, 30-40 minutes.
Remove the lid and fluff the rice with a fork, then cover it again with the lid. Allow it to rest for 5 minutes.
Fluff rice again and serve. Store leftovers in an airtight container once cooled.

About the Product:
Lokwan Wheat is a high-quality variety of wheat primarily grown in India. Renowned for its robust size and excellent milling qualities, it is commonly used in the production of wheat flour for bread and other baked goods. Lokwan wheat is known for its distinctive sweet taste and fine texture, making it a popular choice for traditional Indian rotis. The rich, nutty flavour of Lokwan wheat makes it ideal not only for rotis but also for baking biscuits, cakes, and other pastries. It also contributes to the production of wheat-based products like semolina and broken wheat. Lokwan wheat is highly valued for its versatility and adaptability, catering to diverse culinary needs. Its ease of cultivation, combined with its superior taste and texture, continue to contribute to its widespread popularity in the agriculture and food industry.

About the Product:
Wheat is a staple used in most Indian meals. It's mostly preferred to have at least one or two meals of wheat products in a day.
Organic lokwan wheat is rich in trace minerals, free from impurities, hygienically processed and has a high nutritional value.
Organically grown, experience MeraKisan organic lokwan wheat with wholegrain superior quality that contains the germ, endosperm, and bran, in contrast to refined grains, which retain only the endosperm.
There is a variety of wheat-producing belts that produce various kinds of wheat and rice in the country.
The BB Royal organic brand is one that is known for its high-quality products and its sharbati wheat is no different.

It is rich in iron, minerals and antioxidant. This can be used to make both, sweet and savoury dishes. It is mainly used in making couscous, pasta, upma, and sweet puddings. About the Product:
Indulge in the luxurious taste of Medjool Dates, hailed as the "King of Dates." Known for their plumpness, sweetness, and rich caramel flavour, these dates are a true delicacy. Experience the soft and luscious texture of Medjool Dates, which melt in your mouth, leaving a delightful aftertaste. Perfect as a standalone snack or a versatile ingredient in both sweet and savoury recipes. Sourced from premium date palm trees, Medjool Dates are an excellent source of fibre, potassium, and antioxidants, providing a nourishing treat. Whether enjoyed as a quick energy boost or a guilt-free indulgence, Medjool Dates are nature's candy that will satisfy your cravings while offering numerous health benefits. Treat yourself to the timeless elegance of Medjool Dates, a timeless Middle Eastern delight that has captured hearts and palates around the world with its exceptional quality and irresistible taste.
The process of picking dates involves careful monitoring of the palm trees for ripeness. Ripe date bunches are selected, cut with precision, and sorted based on quality. The harvested dates are then cleaned, packaged, and transported for sale. This ensures that only the finest and freshest dates reach consumers.
Ingredients:
Dates

product_desc: Wood Cold Pressed Groundnut/Peanut Cooking Oil
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Our Wood Pressed Groundnut Oil is 100% pure, vegan, preservative-free, chemical-free, & gluten-free. We press the groundnuts in wooden Kolhus at a low temperature. We use cold-press technology to ensure that the nutrients remain intact. Then, we let the oil sit for sedimentation for 2-3 days. Following this, we sieve filter the groundnut oil. The light texture makes it an ideal cooking oil that pairs with other flavours without overpowering them.

Peanut Oil

About the Product:
Jowar, otherwise known as Sorghum, is a robust grain that has been cultivated in India for many centuries. It is primarily grown in the arid regions of Maharashtra, Karnataka, and Andhra Pradesh and is a significant part of the rural Indian diet. The versatility of this grain lends itself to a host of Indian dishes. When milled into flour, it is used to make 'Jowar roti' or 'bhakri', staple flatbreads in the western and southern regions of India. It is also used in 'khichdi', a comforting one-pot dish. Whole Jowar kernels, known as 'Jowar Dhani', are popped like popcorn and enjoyed as a hearty snack. Jowar's resilience to drought conditions, coupled with its nutritional value and culinary versatility, make it an essential crop in India's agricultural landscape. Its recent resurgence in urban areas signifies a return to traditional ingredients amidst growing health consciousness.

Introducing 24 Mantra Organic Low GI Rice - a flavourful medium-grained rice that is perfect for any Indian dish. This organic rice has a lower glycemic index than its long-grained relative, meaning it retains more water after cooking and helps you maintain a healthier diet. With 5kg of this organic rice, you’ll have plenty to enjoy in all your favourite dishes!

Low in calories.
Rich source of nutrients.
Gluten-free and long shelf-life.
Low glycaemic index.

Rice.

Cook it till water evaporates. 
This variant of rice requires slightly less water when compared to regular sona masoori.

About the Product:
The importance that rice has in an Indian diet is well known. Every cuisine in India, irrespective of the state it originates from, has rice included in its collection. Our 24 Mantra Organic Rice is flavourful medium-grained rice. Unlike its long-grained relative, it is shorter and moist. It means that after cooking, medium-grained rice tends to hold more water. Having low GI, our Organic Rice is useful for those sports and fitness enthusiasts who lose a lot of energy and strength exercising. It is excellent when used to make south Indian food like idlis, biryani, and rice porridge. Explore the whole range of 24 Mantra for premium quality staples.

About the Product:
Maggi Magic Chicken Cubes are a simple way to give an irresistible chicken aroma, perfect colour and rich chicken taste to your homemade non-vegetarian dishes. These versatile Cubes are made using carefully selected ingredients, spices and herbs and are perfect for preparing delicious chicken curries, mutton curries, fried rice, biryani and a variety of other non-vegetarian dishes. Using Maggi Magic Cubes is as easy as crumbling and adding to your dish. So, go ahead and try these Cubes in your Fried Rice, Pulao or Chicken curry today and taste the difference! This pack contains 10 individually wrapped pieces inside to retain the freshness of each cube.
Ingredients:
Iodised Salt, Sugar, Flavour Enhancer (635), Starch, Palm Oil, Chicken Meat (1.8%), Natural Flavour, Chicken Fat (1.1%), Water, Black Pepper Powder, Nature Identical Flavouring Substance, Colour (150d), Acidity Regulator (330), Nutmeg Powder, Onion And Dehydrated Bread. About the Product:
Masoor Dal is one of the most well-known lentils. This dal is with no skin and red in colour. It helps in cleansing your skin by removing impurities. The considerable amounts of fibre in the red lentils help in lowering cholesterol while potassium helps in lowering high blood pressure. Red lentils have a low glycemic index, which makes them an ideal food for people with diabetes. It boosts immune power. This dal is supple and cooks very speedily with a nice, earthy taste It has dietary fibre, vitamin B1, Folate and minerals all with almost no fat.

Carbs: 30 g,

product_desc: Himalayan Pink Rock Salt - For Daily Use, No Chemicals
about_the_product:
About the Product:
Natureland’s Himalayan Pink Rock Salt is mined from the mines that rise from Indo Gangetic Plain, it is mined from Khewra Salt Mine. The chemical composition of Himalayan salt includes 95–96% sodium chloride, with 2-3%  polyhalite and lesser amounts of ten other minerals. The pink color of rock salt is due to the presence of iron oxide in it. It is commonly used in cooking, in place of other table salt, in brine, and for bath products such as bath salts. Blocks of salt are also used as serving dishes and in the preparation of food.
Ingredients:
Rock Salt Crystal

Made form the A2 rich, organic milk of Harlikar and Amrutmahal cows, our desi cow ghee is an incredibly rich, aromatic, and decadent ghee – with just the perfect amount of grains to make it truly divine. Want to add nutrition to your diet but do not want to give up on the taste of your existing dishes? Aashirvaad Nature's Superfoods ensures you can add nutrition to your dough or batter and make the same delicious rotis, paranthas, pooris, idlis and dosas without compromising on the taste. In just 3 easy steps of: Cut the pack, Mix it to your daily atta or batter and cook, as usual, you ensure that you add the benefits of 5 millets without changing the taste. Aashirvaad Nature's Superfoods Multi-Millet Mix is made of 5 millets - jowar, bajra, ragi, navane and quinoa and thus power packs your food with proteins, vitamins, dietary fibre and more.
Ingredients:
Jowar Flour, Navane Flour, Bajra Flour, Ragi Flour And Quinoa Flour.
Nutritional Facts:
As Per - 100 g

Energy - 372 Kcal
Carbohydrate - 75.2 g
Of Which Sugar - 0.8 g
Protein - 9.6 g
Fat - 3.6 g
Dietary Fibre - 9.8 g
Features:
Aashirvaad Nature’s Superfoods Multi Millet Mix is made from Jowar, Bajra, Ragi, Quinoa and Navane Mix
Nutrition with Taste in 3 easy steps - Cut the pack, Mix it with your dough or batter, and cook as usual It is a source of iron, magnesium, fibre, vitamins and more
Add nutrition to your diet without compromising on taste
Mix it with regular atta or dosa batter to make mouth-watering dishes and get the best of both, nutrition and taste

About the Product:
High in protein and fat. In terms of minerals, it is very high in potassium, iron, calcium, magnesium, zinc and phosphorus.Said to be useful in the treatment of poisons / poisonous bites. Highly value by the Chettiar community of Tamil Nadu who offer dishes from this variety on special occasions and for honoured guests.
Ingredients:
Black Raw Rice
How to Use:
This rice has a  Anthocyanin is a pigment that's responsible for the black-purple color of forbidden rice. It's also been found to have potent anti-inflammatory, antioxidant properties..Karuppu kavuni rice is very useful and easy for the preparation of Dosa, Idly and Puttu. Black rice is naturally gluten-free and can be a good option for those with celiac disease or gluten sensitivity.

About the Product:
The traditional ingredients in Real Thai green curry paste include fresh green chillies, shallots, galangal, garlic, lemongrass, kaffir lime leaves, and Thai sweet basil. Thai cuisine is one of the most renowned in the world as it is well known for the diversity of the taste from mild, mellow to outstanding spiciness.
Benefits 
1. Made of all-natural ingredients.
2. Rich paste filled with all essential nutrients.
3. It's easy to use.
Specification:
1. Material : Tamarind Paste (tamarind, water), Fully Refined Soybean Oil 14.6%, Massaman Powder (coriander seed powder, cumin seed powder, cardamom powder, star anise, nutmeg powder, cinnamon powder, bay leaves, cloves), Shallot, Thai Garlic, Dried Chilli, Ginger, Salt, Sugar, Lemongrass, Galangal, Coriander Roots, Distilled Vinegar, Soy Sauce (soybean, wheat flour (gluten), salt, water, sugar), Cardamom Seeds, Kaffir Lime Peels.
2. Capacity : 1 KG
3. Features : Suitable for Vegans, No Artificial flavour & Color, Marinate ingredient.
4. Type : Curry Paste
5. Brand : Real Thai
Nutritional Facts:
About 167 servings Per Container, Serving size 1 tbsp (6g), Amount Per serving Calories 0. %Daily value -- Total Fat 0g - 0%, Saturated Fat 0g - 0%, Trans Fat 0g, Cholesterol 0mg - 0%, Sodium 390mg - 17%, Total Carbohydrate 1g - 0%, Dietary Fiber 0g - 0%, Total Sugars 0g, Includes 0g Added Sugars - 0%, Protein 0g, Vitamin D 0mcg - 0%, Calcium 0mg - 0%, Iron 0mg - 0%, Potassium 40mg - 0%. *The % Daily Value (DV) tells you how much a nutrient in a serving of food contributes to a daily diet. 2.000 calories a day is used for general nutrition advice.
How to Use:
1. Probably the most common use for curry paste is in curries and stews.
2. Cook the curry paste in oil first to bring out its flavours with chicken, paneer or tofu - and vegetables with the warmed paste.

About the Product:
Black Stone Flower or Dagad Phool is a soft brown and black coloured lichen that gives the signature black color to various masalas like Goda Masala/Kala Masala. Stone flowers are very popular in Indian delicacies and snacks. It has a strong earthy aroma and a very dry, light fluffy texture and feels to it.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 45,
Carbs: 5 g,
Fat: 1 g,
Protein: 3 g.
How to Use:
Stone flower is a species of lichen used as a spice in India.
One of the ingredients in East Indian Bottle Masala, the spice is mostly used in dishes like nahari, Bombay biryani, Goan meat stews.
Benefits:
A good pain reliever, Kalpasi helps heal wounds.
It helps treat skin problems and reduces inflammation.
It has antibacterial activity and is effective against protozoans.
It improves digestion and helps suppress respiratory disorders.
It tones up the urinary tract and helps maintain body temperature.

About the Product:
Everest presents their authentic range of masalas that are blended with a wide variety of handpicked and selected spices that bring a whole new flavour and meaning to your dishes. Rake up your favourite recipes and cuisines by adding this magical blend of Everest masalas.
Ingredients:
Everest Shahi Biryani Masala is made from 15 different kinds of perfectly roasted and grounded masala. These include black pepper, chilli, cumin, cassia, cardamom, caraway, mace, nutmeg, dry fenugreek leaves, clove, turmeric and coriander which add lots of flavour and texture to regular rice.
Benefits:
The spices that go into making the Shahi Biryani Masala are storehouses of medicinal properties. For instance, cardamom is efficient in combating acidity, nausea and helps in digestion process. Nutmeg helps in detoxifying the body and is beneficial in curing insomnia. Furthermore, it adds a blast of flavour to your favourite Biryani along with a perfect aroma!

About the Product:
Everest presents their authentic range of masalas that are blended with a wide variety of handpicked and selected spices that bring a whole new flavour and meaning to your dishes. Rake up your favourite recipes and cuisines by adding this magical blend of Everest masalas.
Ingredients:
Coriander, Cumin, Cassia leaf, Black Pepper, Cassia, Chilli, Green cardamom, clove, black cardamom, caraway, Mace, Nutmeg and Turmeric
How to Use:
Par boil 250g basmati rice. In 3 tbsp oil, fry 3sliced onion, 1 tsp each ginger -garlic paste. Add puree of 2 tomatoes, chilli and turmeric powder. Cook till oil seperates. Add 1/2 cup curd and 1 n half tbsp Everest Shahi Biryani masala. Roast. Add 1 n half cup cooked vegetables like green peas, cauliflower, carrots and salt to taste. Grease bowl, spread half the rice, add vegetables, spread remaining rice. Pour 2 tbsp ghee and 1/2 cup milk. Cover and heat for 15 min on low flame. Serve hot with raita.salad.

product_desc: Kashmiri Mongra Kesar Grade A++ - Used For Cooking, Glowing Skin, Safe For Pregnant Women
about_the_product:
About the Product:
LION SAFFRON’S GRADE A++ Mongra Saffron, grown in Kashmir, India, is preferred for its deep red colour, strong flavour, warm aroma and bitter taste, which provides maximum natural flavour and colour to the food, drinks or beauty products. Recognized by the all-red saffron strands, Lion’s 100% pure and natural saffron is brought straight to you from the farmers. This variety of Lion’s is excellent for consumption by a pregnant lady, for Biryani and for preparing desserts like ice creams, kesar pista kulfis, kheers, phirnis, and laddus. Perfect as a gift for Diwali or Rakhi, the saffron is professionally and hygienically packed in a resealable plastic container. The packaging allows easy storage and will protect the saffron from moisture, oxygen and dust. Lion Saffron is India’s oldest name for high-quality and pure Kashmiri saffron. Established in 1957, the brand is recognized and recommended by doctors, chefs and grandmothers/mothers. For the last 65 years, Lion Saffron has worked with the singular goal of bringing the highest quality of saffron to every home in India at an affordable saffron price. By eliminating the middlemen and through the decades-long relationship with the saffron farmers, Lion Saffron will always bring you the finest variety of saffron at an unbeatable price.
Ingredients:
Saffron/Kesar
Nutritional Facts:
For 1g:
3 Calories
0g Fat
0.8g Carbohydrates
0g Sugar
0.2g Protein
Storage and Uses:
DIRECTIONS TO USE: Add 10-12 strands of saffron to HOT milk. Let this liquid sit aside for 1-2 hours. The longer you soak, the better colour and flavour you will get. Add this golden liquid to your dishes. NOTE:  Saffron should NOT be soaked in COLD milk.

About the Product:
Spice up your dishes with Aashirvaad Guntur + Byadagi Chilli Powder which is Crafted for Karnataka. Crafted to Perfection. Aashirvaad Chilli Powder is specially tailored to satisfy diverse palates across Karnataka. Aashirvaad Chilli Powder is a blend of the popular chillies from Andhra Pradesh and Karnataka. This unique blend offers the best of both - the fiery heat of Guntur chillies and the red, vibrant colour of Byadagi chillies. Meticulously crafted with the right proportions, Aashirvaad Chilli powder adds the perfect balance of spiciness and vibrant red colour to every dish you create.

Real Thai Red Curry is made using red bell pepper, red chillies, garlic, ginger, and green onion or shallot. Thai cuisine is the most renowned in the world as it is well known for its diversity in taste from mild to outstanding spiciness.
 Benefits

About the Product:
Sesame is an important ingredient in cooking. Sesame seeds give rich delicate nutty flavour. Almost invisible crunch to your dishes. Sesame seeds are excellent sources of copper. A very good source of manganese calcium phosphorus magnesium iron zinc molybdenum vitamin B1 selenium.
Although much of its calorie comes from fats, sesame contains several notable health-benefiting nutrients, minerals, antioxidants and vitamins. The seeds are especially rich in mono-unsaturated fatty acid, oleic acid, which comprises up to 50 percent of fatty acids in them. Oleic acid helps lower LDL or "bad cholesterol" and increases HDL or "good cholesterol" in the blood. The seeds are also very valuable sources of dietary protein with fine quality amino acids that are essential for growth, especially in children.
Nutritional Facts:
Calories: 89,
Carbs: 2 g,
Fat: 6 g,
Protein: 7 g.
How to Use:
Lightly toasted til are often used whole to sprinkle on bread or salads.
Tandoori flatbreads like naan and kulchas are incomplete without the sesame seeds.
Sesame seeds can be used for sweet and savory dishes.

Mustard oil is a versatile and highly beneficial edible and cooking oil that is extracted from the seeds of the mustard plant. Patanjali Kachi Ghani Mustard Oil is a superior quality vegetable oil that is produced by pressing mustard seeds using the cold press extraction method, also known as "Kachi Ghani".
